channel.title: Gadgets on Bennett Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Gadgets on Bennett Notes

item.title: Pixel 3 Review – Don’t Romanticize Imperfection
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: Let’s not romanticize imperfection. The Pixel 3 is not _The Little Engine That Could, _or some gifted boy who was born without legs. There are people out there who treat Google like the underdog; despite the fact that they have full control over the future of Android. And while there’s nothing wrong with having favorites in a race, it can be dangerous to idolize a runner just based off his shoes.

item.title: Amazon Echo Show Web Browser
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: The Amazon Echo Show has a hidden web browser, and here is how you can enable it. Keep in mind that the Amazon Echo Show is running Android at its core. Therefore, like any normal Android web browser, you have access to the same WebKit features and vulnerabilities when using the browser. Enable Amazon Echo Show Web Browser Go into your settings and go to Legal and Compliance. Then go into Amazon Privacy Notice.

item.title: Best Android Smartwatch 2016
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: {{ youtube Y7ubDt_UTPA }} I have been using the Huawei Watch for over two months now and I can safely say that it’s the best Android smartwatch that I have ever owned. It features a high-quality aluminum design with a crisp 400 x 400 AMOLED display. There’s even a speaker so that you can make phone calls and listen to music right from the watch. The only two things that I don’t like about this watch is the weak vibration motor and the annoying pin charging mechanism.

item.title: Calendar Watch
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: {{ youtube o0hRTNGgm2Y {} This is the Calendar Watch. It is a smartwatch by the company What? The Calendar Watch provides a unique take on smartwatches while adding in a good amount of luxury. Enter in the Calendar Watch Giveaway Below: Calendar Watch Giveaway **Open to anywhere that can physically receive packages from the U.S.**

item.title: Moto Z Play Review
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: {{ youtube 4c-yQIDlFBw {} Are you looking for a phone that will give you the best battery life? If so, the $450 unlocked Moto Z Play is what you need. Check out this video of the Moto Z Play.

item.title: Galaxy S7 Review – Don’t Buy into Hype
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: {{ youtube dWxHDh51zDs {} The Galaxy S7 Review is here. Although I am very critical on Samsung’s skin, I would say that the S7/S7 edge might be the best smartphone of 2016.

item.title: LG G4 Quick Review
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: {{ youtube ysvFJYHgSoE {} tl;dr The LG G4 is seriously one of the best Android smartphones of 2015. It might not have the most attractive design on the outside and in the UI, but it is very responsive and can last you through a whole day with moderate-heavy usage. The LG G4 Quick Review: Here is a quick review of the LG G4. Screen: The LG G4 has a 2560x1440p display.
